snippet: As the nation’s economy slowly recovers, several states are pushing to raise the minimum wage, arguing that $7.25 an hour is too meager to live on.
abstract: Legislators in several states are pushing to raise state minimum wages, arguing that the federal minimum of $7.25 an hour is too meager for anyone to live on; initiatives are increasing pressure on federal lawmakers to raise the national level, as income inequality emerges as a crucial issue in the presidential campaign.
lead_paragraph: As the nation’s economy slowly recovers, several states are pushing to raise the minimum wage, arguing that $7.25 an hour is too meager to live on.

headline.seo: A Campaign to Raise the Minimum Wage
